title: CLI OTP Authenticator Setup for SpigotMC.org
context: Configured a new encrypted OTP authenticator for SpigotMC.org using oathtool and pass with a freshly generated GPG key after removing old keys.
keyIdea: Use a freshly generated GPG key with pass to securely encrypt and store a SpigotMC.org OTP secret, enabling offline code generation with oathtool.
commands:
gpg --full-generate-key
gpg --list-keys
pass init 7C7198C81A4B487998DE36E2962ECC3452A93516
pass insert otp/spigotmc.org
# Paste: BR4VZWHVHE5AXZMW
oathtool --totp -b "$(pass otp/spigotmc.org)"
explanation: This setup establishes a secure, offline OTP authenticator for SpigotMC.org using oathtool and pass. The secret is encrypted under a GPG key, ensuring it stays local and private while allowing quick TOTP generation from the command line.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: Whenever setting up a new 2FA service on Linux that supports TOTP and needs secure local storage under GPG.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Losing the GPG private key makes OTP secrets unrecoverable. Always back up ~/.gnupg and ~/.password-store.
